required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Contrast-enhanced Ultrasound in Follow-up After Endovascular Aneurysm Repair
clinical_study.official_title: Contrast-enhanced Ultrasound in Follow-up After Endovascular Aneurysm Repair

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

oversight_info.authority: Norway:National Committee for Medical and Health Research Ethics

brief_summary.textblock: X-ray computed tomography imaging (CT) is routinely used in follow-up after endovascular aneurysm repair (EVAR). Contrast-enhanced ultrasound (CEUS) has been shown to give accurate information about endoleak after EVAR. Benefits of CEUS over CT include less radiation exposure, avoidance of renal function deterioration due to repeated X-ray contrast agent application and decrease in the cost of EVAR follow-up. This study is designed to investigate if results from literature are reproducible in St Olavs Hospital in Trondheim (Norway), to gain experience with the technique and to introduce CEUS as an alternative for detection of endoleak in this hospital.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: Compare CEUS with CTA sensitivity for detection of endoleak

study_pop.textblock: All patients in follow-up after endovascular implantation of abdominal aortic prothesis, Central Norway

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- in follow-up after endovascular implantation of abdominal aortic prothesis
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
